page.title: 02FARMING LAND
page.content: Ours is a rural area with small farms scattered about the hillsides. Approximately 70% are under 50 acres in size, with the rest being less than 100 acres.The cost to run a farm is varied. 38% cost below Â£5000, 25% cost between Â£5000 and Â£10000 and the rest cost over Â£10000 to maintain. There are a variety of farms. Half of them are mixed farms, 20% are dairy, 20% are beef and the remaining 10% are arable. We found the farms had 50% cows, 22% pigs, 22% sheep and 6% other animals such as ducks, hens and geese. We found that the most common crop was grass at 33% while none of the farmers grew corn. 29% grew potatoes and 13% grew other crops such as turnips, silage and hay.
